author: pcgeek86
body:
## Summary

I tried to run PowerShell 7.1.0 RC2 on Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS 64-bit, on a Raspberry Pi 3 B+, in a Docker container. PowerShell fails to launch.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Obtain a Raspberry Pi 3 B+
1. Install Ubuntu Server 20.04.1 LTS on a microSD card
1. Install Docker
1. Pull the `arm64v8/ubuntu` container image, and run a container
1. Download PowerShell ARM64 `powershell-7.1.0-rc.2-linux-arm64.tar.gz`
1. Extract the archive
1. Try to run `./pwsh`

```
docker run --rm -it arm64v8/ubuntu:focal
apt update && apt install wget --yes
wget 'https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.1.0-rc.2/powershell-7.1.0-rc.2-linux-arm64.tar.gz'
tar -xzvf powershell-7.1.0-rc.2-linux-arm64.tar.gz
./pwsh
```

## Expected behavior

PowerShell runs

## Actual behavior

```none
root@30010574f698:/# ./pwsh
Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80004005
```

## Notes

I tried the suggestion here, but it didn't change the behavior. https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/13166

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @pcgeek86 Please collect and share log as suggested in #13166.

comments.author: alexei-matveev
comments.body: I bet it cannot write to TMPDIR, see https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/46462

title: "Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80004005" on Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS ARM 64-bit  in Docker
